_header: Burning desire to see my fair mistress
_description:
The Fire of Love, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 76) — three 9-line stanzas and 4-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
BRennyng desire to see my fayre maystresHath newe assaylid the
                    nakid pore loggyng…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…As thorugh this rageous fyre which hath me hentThus calle y
                    for yowre socoure pitously
BLHar682.Note: “see” in first line is added above the line by a later hand.
BLHar682.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 682.
